At Affiliate Summit West in Vegas, Monetise Lead Generation is thrilled to connect with potential affiliates/advertisers and explore mutually beneficial collaborations. 

About Monetise Lead Generation:
Monetise is a performance-driven lead-generation network that delivers its 200+ advertisers with transparent, high-quality, clean, and compliant data from its portfolio of managed affiliates and in-house traffic. We remove bad data and fraudulent leads in real-time to ensure that only the best leads arrive at the advertisers' door. Going above and beyond for affiliates, Monetise offers flexible weekly payout terms, direct, exclusive, and in-house/owned offers, and dedicated account management to both its advertisers and affiliates. 

Markets: 
We specialise in the U.S. and UK markets, operating on a CPL/CPA basis.

Affiliate Traffic (Selling): Our expansive network provides affiliate traffic and in-house traffic for advertisers, with a focus  on the U.S. and UK markets.

Name: Mike Bruno
About Me:
Mike Bruno is the Vice President of commerce for CNN Underscored – CNN’s reviews and recommendations guide. He oversees content strategy and production across web, social, email and video.

As a veteran media professional in New York City, Bruno has had the opportunity to manage editorial teams and develop content strategies for some of the world’s most storied brands, including the Billboard Media Group (Billboard, Spin, Vibe and Stereogum) and Entertainment Weekly. During his tenure as head of editorial at Billboard, Bruno spearheaded the creation of several new editorial tentpoles, including the launch of Country, Dance and Hip-Hop Power franchises and the first-ever music-themed show on Snapchat. He also brokered a deal with the Recording Academy to create the brand’s first live, multi-camera video production, The Billboard Live at the Grammys Red Carpet. At EW, as executive editor on the digital side, Bruno led the brand to several media awards, including an Editorial & Design award for Best Blog (EW.com’s PopWatch) and best digital column (Watching TV with Ken Tucker).

Bruno hails from Chicago, where he was born, raised and educated. He received his bachelor’s degree in creative writing from the University of Illinois at Chicago, and also earned a Master’s Degree from the University of Missouri Graduate School of Journalism.

Name: Rachit Chugh
About Me:
Cuelinks is a performance marketing platform designed to bridge the gap between publishers and advertisers, streamlining the process of affiliate marketing. By offering seamless monetization solutions, Cuelinks allows content creators to earn commissions by promoting products and services through automatically generated affiliate links. Instead of manually creating these links, publishers can integrate the "Cuelinks Script" on their websites, which converts outbound links into affiliate links automatically. This simple integration saves time and maximizes earning potential.

For advertisers, Cuelinks offers a wide network of publishers who help promote their products, driving targeted traffic and boosting sales. The platform operates on a performance-based model, where advertisers pay only for actual conversions or specific actions. Additionally, Cuelinks provides detailed reporting and analytics, a Chrome extension for easy link generation, and dedicated account management. This combination of technology, transparency, and support makes Cuelinks an effective and user-friendly affiliate marketing solution for both publishers and advertisers.

This led me to explore natural health solutions, eventually connecting with Dr. Barrie Tan and his groundbreaking research on Vitamin E Tocotrienols. Witnessing the positive impact on my mother's health inspired me to create a brand dedicated to holistic wellness.

In 2018, I founded Wellness Extract, a company committed to "wellness beyond supplements." Our mission is to empower individuals to take control of their health by providing natural, scientifically backed products that go beyond traditional supplements. Rooted in Ayurveda and modern research, we aim to redefine well-being through education, lifestyle changes, and accessible premium healthcare.

Name: Alexandra Forsch
About Me:
Hi, I’m Alexandra Forsch, and I’ve spent over 25 years building expertise in digital media and affiliate marketing. In 2024, I founded Performance Marketing Collab, LLC, a consultancy that delivers tailored strategies that drive measurable growth and lasting impact for businesses. At Performance Marketing Collab, our mission is rooted in strategic insight and proven expertise, helping companies unlock their full potential through customized solutions that align with their unique goals.

Before founding Performance Marketing Collab, I honed my leadership and strategic expertise by managing multi-million-dollar budgets, leading dynamic teams, and driving growth for some of the world’s most recognized brands, including Ticketmaster, British Airways, Booking.com, and Etsy. I’m particularly proud of transforming a challenging market within a global affiliate network into one of its top-performing regions through strategic partnerships and operational excellence.

However, my professional journey didn’t stop at digital growth and affiliate marketing. Over the years, I began to reflect on the impact of my work and the broader industry—particularly the role it plays in promoting mass consumption. This realization sparked a new mission: to champion conscious consumerism and amplify the voices of businesses making a positive impact.

In 2024, inspired by a business podcast about social entrepreneurs, I launched TheGoalForGood.com. This platform is my passion project, designed to spotlight brands that prioritize sustainability, ethical production, and social impact. Through engaging content and curated stories, The Goal for Good educates and inspires a community of conscious consumers, helping them discover products and practices that benefit both people and the planet.

Together, these two ventures—Performance Marketing Collab and The Goal for Good—reflect my commitment to fostering sustainable business practices and driving meaningful change in the marketplace. Whether it’s crafting data-driven marketing strategies or spotlighting brands making a difference, my work is always about creating impact and building lasting connections.

Let’s collaborate to make a positive difference in your business and beyond.
Solutions Needed: Advertising - Google Ads, Coaching & Consulting, eCommerce - Marketing, Marketing - Branding, Marketing - Social Media Marketing, Marketing - Strategy, Website Design & Optimization

About Lab6:
Lab6 Media is a boutique agency specializing in direct response campaigns for niche ecommerce retailers that have $1 Million-$100 Million in gross revenue. Our services include affiliate marketing, search engine marketing, video marketing, influencer marketing, mobile app marketing, and more.

Founded by advertising industry veterans Angel Djambazov, Karen Garcia, and Joel Garcia in 2015, current Lab6 clients include King Arthur Baking, Auttomaticc, Weebly, Pressable, Unity, Fanatics brands Lids.com and MLSStore.com, PE Nation, C4 Energy, Western Chief, Duradero, The Hemp Division, and Harney & Sons Tea. 

About Karen:
Karen has twenty-five years of experience in e-commerce and marketing. Since 1999, she has consulted on and profitably managed dozens of affiliate programs on many different network platforms ranging from large national brands to niche merchants. She was awarded the 2009 ShareASale “Pay It Forward” Award for Industry Advocate for her work, speaks often at conferences and webinars, and has many published industry articles. She also served on the Board of Directors for the Performance Marketing Association for three terms as an officer and continues to serve on the Publisher Recruitment Council. She was honored with a 2016 Pinnacle Award nomination for Affiliate Manager of the Year.

Name: Alex Ger
Company: Adbrand24 Boost your Google search ads and SEO
About Me:
Competitors Outranking You

One of the most significant challenges brands face is competitors regularly outranking them in the ads search results. This not only diminishes your visibility but also redirects potential customers to your competitors. At Google Ads Competitor Shield, we address this problem head-on.

Our Main Focus: Ad Visibility Reduction

Our primary strategy is to reduce the visibility of competitors' ads


Increased Visibility for Your Ads: With competitors' ads minimized, your ads have a better chance of appearing at the top of search results, driving more organic traffic to your brand.

By focusing on these methods, we ensure your brand maintains its rightful position at the top of the search results, maximizing your visibility and attracting more organic traffic.


 About Google Ads Competitor Shield

In the digital age, your brand’s online presence is more crucial than ever. The increasing competition in the market has led to brands using aggressive tactics to manipulate your brand name on Google, thereby siphoning off organic traffic that rightfully belongs to you. This unethical practice not only affects your web traffic but also impacts your revenue and brand reputation.

At Google Ads Competitor Shield, we specialize in protecting your brand from such deceptive strategies. We offer a comprehensive solution designed to ensure that your brand maintains its integrity and continues to attract the organic users it deserves.

Comprehensive Brand Protection

Our services are tailored to protect your brand across the globe. Whether your audience is searching from a mobile device, a tablet, or a desktop, our protection extends to all platforms, ensuring consistent security. We operate around the clock, providing 24/7 monitoring and protection to ensure your brand remains uncompromised.

Expertise in Competitive Analysis

Our team comprises experts in competitive analysis and brand protection. We employ advanced algorithms and machine learning techniques to detect and prevent competitors from manipulating your brand name or any important keywords on Google. This proactive approach helps us stay one step ahead of potential threats, ensuring your brand remains secure.

Real-time Monitoring and Reporting

We understand the importance of real-time data. Our system offers real-time monitoring and reporting, allowing you to see immediate results and understand the impact of our services. You will receive detailed reports on attempts to manipulate your brand name or important keywords and how we have successfully thwarted these efforts.

Customizable Solutions

We recognize that every brand is unique. Therefore, we offer customizable solutions to meet your specific needs. Whether you are a small business or a large enterprise, our services can be tailored to provide the best possible protection for your brand and important keywords.

Global Reach

Our services are not limited by geography. We provide global protection, ensuring that your brand and important keywords are secure no matter where your audience is located. This global reach is particularly beneficial for brands with a multinational presence, as it ensures consistent protection across all markets.

About Me:
Lindsey Grillot is the Sr. Director of Partnerships at Pie (pie.org), a new publisher that offers a fresh approach to how consumers engage with online advertising. Pie combines a customizable ad blocker that rewards users for their attention with powerful shopping tools that incentivize transactions. 

With nearly a decade of experience in commerce strategy, performance marketing, and people leadership, Lindsey has built a reputation for scaling revenue, cultivating strategic partnerships, and leading high-performing teams. Her career spans companies at all stages of growth, from Series A startups to Fortune 100 organizations.

Prior to joining Pie, Lindsey played a key role in the success of Honey, a high-growth startup acquired by PayPal in 2020. Lindsey is a prominent figure in the affiliate marketing industry, appearing regularly as a speaker at events like Affiliate Summit, PI Live and LeadsCon, and has been recognized nationally for her achievements. 

Outside of her professional work, Lindsey is passionate about mentoring the next generation of business leaders. As an Alumni Mentor for her alma mater, Penn State, she provides guidance to students and recent graduates navigating the transition to the workforce. In April, Lindsey was honored with the 2024 Outstanding Young Professional award by Penn State’s Smeal College of Business for her contributions to the University. Lindsey resides in Connecticut.

About Me:
Kelly Ground is a seasoned leader in affiliate and partnership marketing with nearly 20 years of experience. She is the Founder and Principal Consultant of breakingGround Solutions, where she specializes in driving innovative growth strategies and scaling partnership programs for brands. Kelly currently serves as the Treasurer of the Performance Marketing Association, bringing financial leadership and strategic oversight to the organization.

Throughout her career, Kelly has consistently delivered transformative results. As Chief Growth Officer at a former acquisition marketing publisher, she spearheaded initiatives that drove over 100% user acquisition growth, earning her recognition as one of the Top 50 Women Leaders of Tampa for 2024. During her 6.5 years as Senior Director of Strategy and Insights at Acceleration Partners, Kelly guided global affiliate marketing programs and was named a Top 30 Partnership Marketing Changemaker in the US by Hello Partner in 2023.

Earlier, as Senior Digital Marketing Manager at HSN, Kelly significantly boosted revenue through affiliate and display marketing programs. Her diverse experience spans industries such as employee benefits publishing, manufacturing, and telecommunications, demonstrating her adaptability and strategic acumen.

A recognized thought leader, Kelly is a frequent speaker at affiliate marketing conferences and a published author in top industry publications. She holds a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science with a minor in Journalism from Clemson University.

Outside of work, Kelly enjoys spending time with her husband, two children, and their dog. Her weekends are filled with cheering on her daughter at soccer matches and her son on the golf course. Name: Samantha Gutstadt
About Me:
Samantha Gutstadt is a multi-talented actress, host, writer, digital influencer, content creator, podcaster, and producer. As the co-founder of the comedy duo Don’t Call Me Mommy, she brings humor and authenticity to parenting, pop culture, and lifestyle content.

Aa a writer, Samantha is a published columnist for Parents Magazine and Romper, and her work has been featured on Parents.com, Sephora.com, Mom.me, Alibaba.com, Mother.ly, and more. She also runs her own blog, SamSoMuch, where she shares her experiences on motherhood, fashion, beauty, and everyday life.

Through Don’t Call Me Mommy, Samantha and her creative partner Haely produce engaging branded content for major companies like Walmart, Target, FabFitFun, and Parents. Their comedic take on motherhood even landed them a feature on CBS as one of the funniest mom content creators. Samantha has also created and starred in digital series for Mom.me, FabFitFun, Parents, ByHeart, and more, with some of her videos amassing over 9 million views.

With a strong social media presence, Samantha has cultivated an engaged following of over 225,000 Instagram followers and 25,000 TikTok fans, where she shares her signature mix of humor, lifestyle, and parenting content. Her influence has been recognized by Forbes, naming her one of LA’s Influencers to Watch, and she was featured in Yahoo/AOL’s In The Know series.

Beyond the digital space, Samantha is also making waves in the podcasting world. She co-created and co-hosts Where The Bodies Are Buried, a gripping true crime podcast produced in collaboration with Audio Up and Grinning Dog Entertainment. The show debuted with a major breakthrough—solving a cold case in its very first episode—and quickly climbed to the Top 20 on the Atlantic charts for Best Podcasts of 2021. Samantha even appeared on Access Hollywood to discuss the show and was nominated for a Webby Award in the True Crime Podcast category.

Name: Garth Harris
About Me:
Since joining CAKE in 2010 as a Technical Support Analyst, I’ve been privileged to grow alongside the company through various roles and challenges. Early on, I transitioned into an onboarding role and later became the leader of the onboarding team, helping to ensure a seamless experience for new clients.

As CAKE expanded, I took on the role of Client Services Manager, overseeing account management, technical support, and onboarding. In 2013, I had the unique opportunity to move to London to open our UK office, where I built and led a team across sales, marketing, and client services. By 2015, I was heading our Solution Engineering team and later stepped into the Vice President of Client Services role, overseeing client success globally.

In 2020, I established and led our Professional Services division, driving new opportunities for growth and innovation. My career at CAKE reached a new milestone in 2024 when I was appointed General Manager. In this role, I’ve spearheaded transformative operational strategies to enhance profitability and efficiency.

As we enter 2025, CAKE and our sister company TUNE are collaborating to bring greater value to our extensive client base through networking and technology solutions. I’m excited to lead operational efforts across both brands as we explore new avenues for success.

Stephanie Harris is the Founder & CEO of PartnerCentric, the largest woman-owned performance marketing agency in the US. A veteran of the space, Stephanie got her start as an award-winning affiliate program manager, personally managing at one time some of the largest programs in the PartnerCentric portfolio today. Name: Michael Jaconi
About Me:
Michael Jaconi is the Co-Founder and CEO of Button, the mobile commerce technology company that is powering a commerce-driven internet. Button drives over $1B in commerce through its platform each month and enables creators, publishers, and retailers to maximize the performance of their commerce and affiliate strategies. Button has also been named a “best place to work” every year since its founding. Jaconi formerly served as the CEO of Rakuten Loyalty and Executive Officer of parent company Rakuten. Leading the business that became Rakuten Loyalty through its acquisition, Jaconi helmed Rakuten’s US M&A strategy and led Rakuten’s $100M investment in Pinterest returning billions of dollars of shareholder value. 

Jaconi has been a lifelong entrepreneur starting his first company at the age of 16, and has founded and managed four companies in the marketing and technology industries. Jaconi is a frequent speaker at entrepreneurial events and business schools, and he received his bachelor's degree from USC, married his college sweetheart, and has 2 kids, a puppy, and baby #3 on the way in March 2025. Even though he’s a CA native, he lives in Brooklyn and spends a lot of time in his happy place, Sag Harbor.

Name: Chinmay Jain
About Me:
Chief Technology Officer at Celeris, Celeris is a global payment orchestration platform designed to optimise transactions for eCommerce businesses.
It simplifies payment processing through features like intelligent routing, dynamic failover, and built-in fraud prevention, partnering with over 60 global acquirers/processors and supporting more than 100 payment methods. On average, Celeris clients see a significant increase in payment acceptance rates and can recover failed transactions via dynamic cascading.
Tailored for subscription and recurring billing models, the platform provides powerful tools, including automated card updates, a dynamic & flexible subscription engine along with integrated reporting and reconciliation.
Celeris supports ISVs, ISOs, PSPs, and Large Direct Merchants to grow their businesses, enhancing their payment processes and overall business operations.
In a nutshell, we help our customers:
- Increase Revenue
- Improve Customer Experience
- Reduce costs

Name: Reginald Jennings Jr
About Me:
We Can Help You Build a Thriving E-Commerce Business with Your Family

At Ecom Family Academy, we are committed to helping aspiring entrepreneurs—just like you—break into the e-commerce space and build sustainable, profitable online businesses that create financial freedom for you and your family.

Meet the Founder

Reginald Jennings, founder of Ecom Family Academy, is a seasoned entrepreneur, coach, and digital strategist who has helped countless individuals launch and scale successful online businesses. With years of experience in dropshipping, print-on-demand, branding, and digital marketing, he knows what it takes to turn an idea into a scalable, automated, and highly profitable business.

Reginald’s mission is simple: to help everyday people—families, couples, and individuals—achieve financial independence through e-commerce. He believes that success isn’t reserved for a select few; it’s available to anyone willing to learn, apply, and stay consistent.

What We Do & How We Help

We provide:
✅ Hands-on mentorship – Learn from real-world experience, not just theory.
✅ Proven strategies – We share the exact frameworks that have helped our students reach $10K, $50K, and even $100K months.
✅ Business automation – Scale with ease by implementing the right systems.
✅ Paid advertising & conversion optimization – Turn visitors into loyal customers.

But beyond the numbers, we help you build a business that works for your lifestyle. Whether you’re a solo entrepreneur, a couple, or looking to create a family-run brand, we show you how to do it together.

Why This Matters for You

Whether you’re starting from scratch or ready to scale, we’ll help you:
✅ Identify the right business model for your goals.
✅ Learn how to attract and retain customers profitably.
✅ Create an automated, revenue-generating business that frees up your time.

We Can Do More Together

Our mission is simple: help families and individuals create generational wealth through e-commerce.

If you’re serious about starting or growing an online business and want a roadmap, a community, and mentorship that works, let’s connect.

We’re ready to help you build a thriving business for yourself and your family. Are you?

Name: Kirk Kazanjian
About Me:
I lead a book and digital content development company called Literary Productions.

Literary Productions is unique in the publishing industry. We’ve been described as a super literary agency, mega-author incubator, first rate publicity and marketing, firm, multimedia, creator, and mammoth idea factory all combined into one company. 

We develop all of our book concepts in-house and partner with carefully selected authors to bring them to life. 

We then find the best publishers around the world to print and distribute our books — often in multiple languages — and oversee the entire development process. 

Working closely with our expert authors — including celebrities, business executives, medical professionals, master chefs, leading brands, and some of the world’s top social media influencers — Literary Productions develops popular non-fiction books in such categories as business, personal finance, real estate, politics, self-help, history, food, health, fitness, religion, travel, sports, biographies, parenting, pets, popular reference, cookbooks, children’s, young adult, and more. 

We’re one of the nations leading book producers, and have been creating bestsellers for more than 25 years. 

We are intimately involved in all aspects of making each book a success — from crafting marketing plans to leading omnichannel publicity efforts — in order to ensure that every title generates maximum attention and sales, both at launch and for years to come. 

We also turn some of our titles into TV shows and ancillary products around the world.

Livemetrics is more than just a tool—it’s the result of my passion for technology and my dedication to leveraging data to drive business growth.

In 2022, I became a public speaker at international conferences such as Affiliate World and Affiliate Summit. On stage, I’ve had the chance to share my insights and the case studies from our agency, demonstrating how finding the right balance between branding and performance can make a significant impact.

I am deeply passionate about artificial intelligence, digital marketing, and e-commerce. I constantly strive to push the boundaries of what’s possible and shape the future of the industry. My journey is driven by a desire to innovate, learn, and contribute to the evolution of our sector.

Today, Convergen Agency and livemetrics has grown to a team of 40 passionate collaborators who share the same commitment to innovation and Performance Each project is an opportunity for us to push the boundaries, deliver tailored solutions, and achieve tangible results through a data-driven approach.

About Me: Ross LaPietra is a dynamic and visionary leader who serves as the CEO of Credit Saint, a renowned and trusted name in the credit repair industry. Ross has dedicated his career to developing innovative solutions that empower clients to take control of their credit profiles. Under his guidance, Credit Saint has become synonymous with integrity, excellence, and a client-centric approach. Ross embarked on a mission to disrupt the credit repair industry by introducing a comprehensive and transparent approach. His expertise in leveraging data-driven strategies, combined with a genuine desire to make a difference, has resulted in countless success stories for Credit Saint's clients. Ross understands the importance of personalized solutions and has implemented a robust system that tailors credit repair strategies to individual needs, resulting in highly effective and tailored results. Beyond his role at Credit Saint, Ross is a respected figure in the financial services industry. He actively participates in industry forums and conferences, sharing his insights and advocating for consumer rights. Ross's expertise and thought leadership have earned him recognition as a trusted authority in credit repair, and he is often sought after for his expertise by both industry professionals and media outlets. Outside of his professional pursuits, Ross is a dedicated family man and finds joy in spending quality time with his loved ones. He is an avid sports enthusiast and enjoys staying active, both mentally and physically. As the CEO of Credit Saint, Ross LaPietra continues to spearhead the company's mission of providing ethical and effective credit repair solutions. About Me:
Corey is a 25+ year veteran of integrated communications with an emphasis on influencer marketing. Before joining /prompt. Lippe Taylor as Managing Director of Creator Marketing, Corey spent time at global PR and digital advertising agencies (Edelman, Dentsu and Ogilvy) focusing on bringing innovation to creator content strategies. Corey advises clients having the perspective of three sides of the creator economy – designing programs for global brands, having represented talent during his tenure at Elite, and creating content with his Husband and Son on their personal channel @RainbowDads (with over 1.3M followers across TT, IG and YouTube) in partnership with the NFL, Nickelodeon, Fanatics, Marriott, Tuft&Needle, GoHenry and Native, among others. He has developed global influencer marketing programs representing clients like Galderma (Cetaphil), Bayer, Sanofi, Kroger, Lidl, Kellogg’s, Unilever (AXE, Dove, Vaseline), PepsiCo, Nespresso, DSW, the New York Times and many more.

About Monetise Lead Generation:

Experience: With a robust 12-year history in affiliate marketing, our team brings a wealth of industry expertise.

Markets: We specialize in the U.S. and UK markets, operating on a CPL/CPA basis.

Portfolio: Managing over 200 offers, we own and operate multiple brands, ensuring a diverse and high-performing selection.

What We Offer:

Affiliate Traffic (Selling): Our expansive network provides affiliate traffic for your offers, focusing on the U.S. and UK markets.

Traffic (Buying): We actively seek quality traffic from affiliates to enhance the success of our U.S. and UK offers, guaranteeing exclusivity for your campaigns.

Name: Brian Michon
About Me:
Fractional CTO | E-Commerce, SaaS & AI Expert | Affiliate & Rewards Tech

Product and customer-focused leader with a deep software engineering background (MIT/Stanford). I have founded and led consumer startups, held VP/CTO positions at Intuit and Cartera (Rakuten), and now help early-stage companies scale their technology, optimize product-market fit, and drive growth through innovation.

I specialize in:
	• E-Commerce & Affiliate Shopping – Helping platforms boost customer engagement and sales growth through optimized loyalty and cashback ecosystems.
	• SaaS & Cloud Computing – Ensuring scalability and flexibility with cutting-edge SaaS and cloud solutions.
	• AI & Emerging Technologies – Leveraging AI to drive efficiencies, enhance personalization, and open new business opportunities.

As CTO and CISO of Cartera (Cartera.com) A Rakuten company, I led Engineering, Product Management, and Operations for one of the most successful affiliate e-commerce loyalty platforms, enabling customers to earn over 3 billion rewards annually across 1,500+ online retailers, 100K+ in-store locations, and 42K+ dining locations. I also spearheaded white-labeled shopping browser extensions, achieving 5-star user ratings and driving $300M+ in shopping revenue.

Now, I work as a Fractional CTO, providing technical strategy, product innovation, and scalable architecture guidance to fast-growing startups:
	• Kiwii Inc. (addkiwii.com) – Technical advisor for product strategy, browser extension architecture, and growth planning.
	• Slater Technology Fund (Slaterfund.com)  – Advisor, evaluating early-stage technology ventures at Brown University for technical feasibility and market potential.
	• FanFundu.com – Assisting with outsourcing of browser extensions and mobile shopping apps.
	• GiveFreely.com (and though them TripAdvisor) – Provided guidance on browser extension development and outsourcing.

Through MITCTO.com, I help e-commerce, fintech, and affiliate marketing startups scale AI-driven commerce platforms, optimize monetization, and accelerate go-to-market strategies.

If you’re attending Affiliate Summit West, let’s connect—whether you need expert guidance on browser extensions, affiliate shopping, or a Fractional CTO to scale your platform.

Name: Marshall Nyman
About Me: Marshall Nyman is the Founder and CEO of NYMO & Co., a boutique affiliate marketing agency that helps emerging brands grow. He is also the host of the Performance Marketing Spotlight podcast where industry veterans share their experience in the affiliate marketing space. After completing his MBA, Marshall moved to New York City in 2011, which got him his start in the performance marketing world at a startup affiliate network. In 2017 Marshall launched NYMO with his first client and the goal of providing trust and transparency in the world of affiliate marketing. NYMO focuses on a content based approach to its partnerships to maximize brand awareness and new customer acquisition. Marshall is based in Los Angeles with his wife Olympia and children Myla, Oriana, and Morty. He enjoys the outdoors, travel, music, cooking and basketball.

Name: Kristyn Outlaw
About Me:
I’m currently a Senior Account Executive working with Plura.ai, The Blacklist Alliance, and NumberVerifier.

At Plura.ai, I help businesses across various industries implement customized AI agents that streamline operations and optimize workflows. These AI-driven solutions are tailored to each client’s specific needs, whether it's enhancing customer service, improving predictive analytics, or automating routine tasks. Our goal is to help businesses operate more efficiently, make smarter decisions, and stay competitive in today’s data-driven world.

With The Blacklist Alliance, I assist in protecting businesses from legal risks by managing interactions with known litigants. Through our litigation firewall, we prevent clients from contacting or being contacted by individuals or entities with a history of legal disputes, helping them avoid unnecessary exposure to costly litigation and reducing operational risks.

At NumberVerifier, we provide a call monitoring solution designed to ensure your number isn’t flagged as SPAM or SCAM likely. Our technology helps businesses improve their call reputation, increasing connection rates and ensuring that communications reach the intended audience without being blocked or marked as fraudulent.

In each of these roles, my focus is on leveraging cutting-edge technology to drive smarter, safer, and more efficient solutions for my clients, helping them thrive in an ever-evolving business landscape.

Name: Cooper Schwartz
About Me:
As a founding partner of Ad Practitioners (the portfolio company that owns and operates Money.com and ConsumersAdvocate.org), I believe a great deal of our success can be attributed to the unparalleled transparency we provide our partners. For our part, we seek out relationships with data-driven marketers goaled towards achieving more efficiency and scale with their digital acquisition budget(s).

We further seek to align incentives by structuring campaign economics on a performance basis and provide unrivaled transparency into our media buying strategy. 

Sharing granular campaign data is the best way to demonstrate the value our service provides while establishing a solid foundation for mutual trust. 

Through a close adherence to my personal code of ethics which places a high value on honesty, integrity, empathy, respect, and equality (along with my 10+ years of experience in the digital marketing industry), I've supported some 1,700+ companies in their effort to achieve 2-3x greater efficiency and scale across multiple digital acquisition channels with a primary focus on improving traffic quality and harnessing consumer intent. 

If the above resonates with your own personal and professional, motivations, values, and morals...Let's start talking. 

A bit more about our brands: 

CONSUMERSADVOCATE.ORG helps over 3,000,000 consumers each month make informed buying decisions. We work with marketing executives from Fortune 1000 companies to reach their target audiences in financial services, banking, insurance, home services, software, senior care, and small business industries. A few of our strategic partners include: Quicken Loans, Progressive, CHASE Bank, AIG, LendingTree, The Home Depot, Robinhood, Ally Bank, Liberty Mutual, Betterment, SoFi, Terminix, and many more.

MONEY.COM is a digital source of personal stories, candid conversations, and useful information about money and the way it affects our lives. With a nearly 50-year legacy of providing trustworthy advice on every aspect of personal finance, MONEY helps its readers lead a richer life—in every sense of the word. Signature franchises include a bevy of Best-In categories such as Best Colleges, Best in Travel, Best Banks, Best Credit Cards, and Best Places to Live, with an aim to capitalize on your finances and promote your well-being.

Success, for me, is about creating opportunities, continuing growth, and making a positive impact in the business world.

Name: Aaron Spivak
About Me:
Aaron is a 29-year-old Canadian serial entrepreneur who co-founded Revitasize at 18 years old—an organic cold-pressed juice kitchen serving high-quality juices, smoothies, acai bowls, and a variety of vegan options. Within four years, Revitasize expanded to over eight locations across Toronto.

He recently launched @thefoundersclub, a community for high-growth founders seeking virtual, in-person, and local connections with like-minded CEOs, founders, and executives in the CPG, e-commerce, and retail sectors.

Prior to this, Aaron co-founded a sleep improvement company called Hush, selling a product now considered to be the world's most popular (and reviewed) weighted blanket—designed to help those with sleep issues, anxiety, insomnia, ADHD, and more. Within its first 24 months, Hush grew into an eight-figure brand. The company launched a successful Kickstarter campaign that raised over $1.5 million in 30 days—making it one of the top 10 most-funded Canadian 30-day campaigns ever.

Hush also appeared on the Canadian hit TV show Dragons' Den and earned the "Most Epic Pitch" of the season, securing a bidding war between all six dragons.

In 2021, Aaron sold Hush to Canadian sleep giant Sleep Country in a landmark acquisition, marking a significant milestone in Canadian e-commerce history.

The brand has become trusted by over 150,000 people, innovating with products like the Hush Pillow, Mattress, Iced Cooling Sheets, and more.

Aaron is also a former Canadian Junior Hockey League player, ranked 5th in all-time scoring in the OJHL, an OUA Champion, public speaker, and startup advisor.

He was named to Forbes 30 Under 30 in 2020.

Name: Michael Weaver
About Me:
Fairchild RMN is a Retail Media Network company providing Retail Proximity Advertising including store level attribution to delight shoppers while shopping at their local stores.  
Our customers are Retailers with stores at Malls and Shopping Centers around the world, companies that sell their products at these store locations, and digital native companies seeking to connect with the right shoppers, at the right time, in the right place, with the right message.
Fairchild RMN has three business units:
LOCLshop Media
LOCLshop Capital
LOCLshop Services

LOCLshop Media:  Fairchild owns and operates the LOCLshop Media Network, a proximity advertising platform for Retailers and Brands.
LOCLshop Media can deliver Retail Proximity Advertising with closed loop in-store attribution reporting to over 14M unique shoppers each month across over 10,000 shopping centers with more than 160,000 stores.  LOCLshop Media allows advertisers to Reach their Audience of Shoppers, Where it Matters, When It Matters. 
Retailers and Brands buy digital mobile ads on LOCLshop Media to target shoppers on their mobile devices while shopping.  LOCLshop allows advertisers to deliver personalized ads to shoppers while the shoppers are at their local shopping center and mall.  
These ads deliver higher returns because they are delivered to the right person, at the right place, at the right time, with the right message. 
LOCLshop is a performance marketing platform.  LOCLshop only charges the advertiser when the ad is delivered to the shopper’s phone. 
Additionally, LOCLshop offers in-store attribution reporting and analytics to the retailer’s marketing team and business leadership. 
To benchmark the effectiveness of these Retail Center Media Network campaigns, Fairchild created the RePAA Index.  This is an index of the effectiveness of a Retail Marketer’s Retail Proximity Advertising Attribution results.
